isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - INSTALL - RIGHT COUNTERSHAFT BEARINGS

step1.para: Engage 4th and 5th speed sliding clutch into the mainshaft 4th gear ( Figure 241). This should keep the 4th speed mainshaft gear from dropping far enough away from the center to cause a timing error.

figure.caption: Figure 240. Engage 4th and 5th Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Engage the timing tooth on the right countershaft between the two marked teeth on the drive gear, ensuring that the left countershaft is still in time ( Figure 242).

figure.caption: Figure 241. Engage Timing Tooth on Right Countershaft

step1.para: Center the rear of the shaft in the bore and partially install the front bearing. Partially install the rear bearing ( Figure 243).

With a screwdriver, shift the mainshaft sliding clutches into each gear ( Figure 244). If the clutch will not go into a gear, it indicates that the gear set is out of time. The bearings on the top counter- shaft must then be removed and the top countershaft retimed with the mainshaft.

figure.caption: Figure 243. Shift Mainshaft Sliding Clutches into Gear

step1.para: Use a bearing driver to complete the installation of the front and rear countershaft bearings ( Figure 245).

figure.caption: Figure 244. Complete Installation of Front and Rear Countershaft Bearings

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the groove in the rear countershaft bearing bore ( Figure 246). Drive both countershafts back until the rear bearings seat against the snap rings.

figure.caption: Figure 245. Install Snap Ring in Rear Countershaft Bearing Bore Groove
